business.headline: Diffusion Engineers IPO opens for subscription: Should you subcribe?The price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 159 and Rs 168 per share. Investors can apply for a minimum lot of 88 shares, requiring a retail investment of Rs 14,784.
Manba Finance IPO allotment: Check status, listing gain, subscriptionManba Finance IPO opened for subscription on September 23 and ran until September 25, generating huge bids.

Hyundai Motors IPO: Can it beat Maruti Suzuki's market valuation?Hyundai, the second-largest automaker in India, has maintained a steady market share of 15-17% since 2008. But does it have what it takes to beat market leader Maruti Suzuki's valuation?

Gold, silver price today, September 26, 2024: Yellow metal records dip, silver trades higher on MCXGold Price Today 26 September 2024: Gold is trading on the lower side while silver rates have recorded a hike on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Thursday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Sensex, Nifty hit record high as rally extends for 5th straight sessionThe S&P BSE Sensex rose to an all-time high of 85,333.23 in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed to 26,056.

Hyundai to Swiggy: 5 big IPOs set to light up Dalal Street before 2024 endsFrom Hyundai Motors' massive offering to Swiggy's much-anticipated debut, the year's final IPOs could be the most exciting ones yet.

Sensex, Nifty hit record high as power and financial stock drive market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 255.83 points to end at 85,169.87, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.75 points to close at 26,004.15.

PNB, SBI, UCO: JM Financial lists 11 PSU bank stocks worth buying after selloffSince reaching its 52-week high, the PSU Bank index has dropped by 15%, with banks like UCO Bank, Bank of India (BOI), Indian Overseas Bank (IOB), and Union Bank of India seeing sharper declines of 25-30%.

Easy Trip Planners shares plunge 20% to record low. Here's what happenedThe steep decline in share price was triggered by news that promoter Nishant Pitti plans to sell 15 crore shares, representing 8.5% of the company's total share capital, in a block deal.

Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat see lowest youth unemployment, Kerala strugglesMadhya Pradesh and Gujarat have emerged as the best performers, boasting the lowest youth unemployment rates, while Kerala struggles with one of the highest.

Coldplay mania: Mumbai hotel rates up by 300% for concert weekendWith Coldplay set to perform at DY Patil Stadium on January 18-19 and 21, 2025, hotel prices in Mumbai have skyrocketed, which might leave fans scrambling for accommodation.

Explained: Why Reliance Power shares hit 5% upper circuit today Reliance Power stock: What's behind the fresh rally? Investors are buzzing as the company makes big moves—find out what's driving the surge.

Salaried employees work longer hours than casual workers, finds surveyFor many corporate workers, these 48-hour weeks translate to roughly 9 hours of work each day if they're working five days a week, or 8 hours if it's a six-day work week.
Hyundai IPO gets Sebi clearence. Check expected listing date The company submitted its draft papers in June 2024 and the IPO may be launched as soon as October.
KRN Heat Exchanger IPO opens for bidding: Subscribe or skip? The IPO of KRN Heat Exchanger is entirely a fresh issue of 1.55 crore shares and will be open for subscription till September 27.

Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Foxconn eyes $1 billion display module plant in Tamil Nadu: ReportThis will be the first display module facility Foxconn has built in India, and it is expected to mainly support the production of Apple's iPhones.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as investors take breather after record runThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 20.70 points to 84,893.34 at 10:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 18.20 points to trade at 25,922.20.

Shankh Air ready for takeoff: All you need to know about India's new airlineShankh Air, owned by Shankh Aviation Private Limited, has been granted a No Objection Certificate (NOC) by the ministry, valid for three years.

Sensex crosses 85,000, Nifty hits 26,000: Will bull run continue on D-Street? While Sensex and Nifty closed below record highs amid volatility, analysts remain cautiously optimistic, noting that Indian equities have defied global uncertainty to post strong gains this year.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: What are 3 achievements, weaknesses of Modi government: What Chidambaram saidP Chidambaram credited the NDA government for carrying forward improvement of the network of national highways that was started by Atal Bihari Vajpayee's Golden Quadrilateral project.
Mumbai court sentences Sanjay Raut to 15 days imprisonment in defamation caseMumbai court sentences Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Sanjay Raut to 15 days imprisonment in defamation case

Kangana Ranaut's 'Emergency' can be released if certain cuts are made, court toldThe Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) informed the Bombay High Court that actor and BJP MP Kangana Ranaut's 'Emergency' film can be released only if certain cuts are made as suggested by the film body's revising committee.

Why it's lonely at the top for Hezbollah chief NasrallahIn the past week, Hezbollah has lost many of its top leaders to Israeli offensive. Despite the Iranian support and counsel, Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah might be lonely. Does this provide a golden opportunity for Israel?

Inside Doctor Death's 'suicide pod' that has sparked an ethics debateThe futuristic-looking capsule has sparked a global debate on ethics after an American woman became the first person to use the pod to end her life.

Suspect argued with victim before killing her, says suicide noteThe suspect's body was found in Odisha's Bhadrak district. According to the police, he was found hanging, and a case of suicide has been filed at the Dushuri Police Station.

Temple defaced in US with 'Hindus go back' message, 2nd incident in 10 daysThe Sacremento Police said that the vandalism incident was being classified as a "hate crime". Police added that the accused also cut water lines at the property.

More leadership drama at OpenAI, Mira Murati and two others leave OpenAI undergoes significant leadership changes as CTO Mira Murati and two senior leaders depart, marking a major transition for the company.

After Coldplay-BookMyShow mess, make reselling concert tickets illegal in IndiaBookMyShow has launched a police investigation into the 'third-party' apps that allowed people and dealers to resell Coldplay concert tickets at inflated prices – up to Rs 7.7 lakh for a ticket originally priced at Rs 12,500.

Atishi no. 1, Arvind Kejriwal in no. 41 in Delhi Assembly's new seating planAtishi, who was sworn in as the Chief Minister of Delhi after Arvind Kejriwal resigned from the position, earlier occupied seat number 19.

1 dead as rain paralyses Mumbai, schools shut today, more showers expected Live UpdatesMumbai rain: One person drowned in an overflowing drain in Mumbai as heavy rain battered the city and affected local train and flight operations. However, the situation returned to normal as rain stopped.

Consistent rant: BJP leader on Kangana Ranaut's 'baseless' farm law remarksBJP spokesperson Jaiveer Shergill said that Kangana's "consistent rant, useless, baseless and illogical statements against the Sikh community" and the farmers of Punjab damaged the "good work" being done by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
Watch: Saturn emerges from behind Moon in stunning videoThe video shows the ringed planet slowly revealing itself from behind the Moon's illuminated edge.

Author Jhumpa Lahiri declines award over New York museum's ban on keffiyehsThe museum said the Pulitzer Prize-winning author withdrew her acceptance after it fired staff members for wearing clothing expressing political views.

Ex-Tamil Nadu minister gets bail, Supreme Court cites delay in trialFormer Tamil Nadu minister V Senthil Balaji has got bail from the Supreme Court in a money laundering case, saying that stringent bail conditions and delay in trial cannot go together.

Will blow your country to smithereens: Trump blasts Iran amid death threatsFormer US President Donald Trump said Iran will be "blown to smithereens" if the Islamic country is involved in assassination attempts on former presidents and presidential candidates.

Jigra trailer: Alia Bhatt ready for anything to save Vedang RainaThe official trailer of Vasan Bala's Jigra was released today, September 26. The film, starring Alia Bhatt and Vedang Raina in lead roles, will hit the theatres on October 11.

Suspect in Bengaluru woman's murder found dead in Odisha, suicide note recoveredA purported suicide note was found inside a notebook in which the suspect confessed to murdering the Bengaluru woman and chopping her body into pieces.

Pawan Kalyan and Prakash Raj clash over Tirupati prasadam issueA controversy has emerged between Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan and actor Prakash Raj over the Tirupati prasadam issue. The situation escalated as Prakash Raj urged Kalyan to focus on the investigation, while Kalyan accused Raj of mocking Hindu sentiments.

Sobhita Dhulipala on finding her 'ideal' love in Naga Chaitanya | ExclusiveSobhita Dhulipala, in an exclusive conversation with India Today Digital, shared why she chose a poetic caption for her engagement pictures with Naga Chaitanya.
Mumbai Zomato agent walks amid heavy rain to deliver order after bike breaks downA Zomato agent walked through Mumbai's waterlogged streets to deliver food after his bike broke down.

Arijit Singh reacts after security grabs female fan by neck at UK concert: Not fairSinger Arijit Singh apologised to a woman at his UK concert after security held her by the neck. He told her that he wished he could protect her.

Israel prepares for Lebanon ground offensive as Biden warns of 'all-out war'More than 600 people have been reportedly killed in Lebanon since Israel began an intense campaign on Monday to destroy Hezbollah infrastructure. As per UN figures, some 90,000 people in Lebanon have been newly displaced.

Multiplex association hits back at KJo: Movie outing costs Rs 1,560 not Rs 10,000Karan Johar claims a movie outing for a family of four costs Rs 10,000, but the Multiplex Association of India states it's only Rs 1,560, citing lower ticket prices and flexible cinema costs.
Video: Vicky Kaushal jets off to Abu Dhabi for IIFA 2024Actor Vicky Kaushal left for Abu Dhabi on September 26. The actor is all set to host IIFA 2024 along with Shah Rukh Khan and Karan Johar.

Krystle D'Souza says she and Karan Tacker no longer on talking termsKrystle D'Souza addressed the long-standing rumours about her relationship with Karan Tacker. She emphasised the personal nature of relationships and the mutual decision not to label theirs. She also added that they are not on talking terms now.

sports.headline: Women's T20 World Cup: Lisa Sthalekar backs India to at least reach semi-finalsLisa Sthalekar ranked India as one of the favourites to at least reach the semi-final of the Women's T20 World Cup, if not the final. India will aim to clinch their maiden women's World Cup title.

Don't know what happened to it: Greg Chappell's Baggy Green goes missingAustralian legend Greg Chappell has revealed that his cherished Baggy Green cap has gone missing after being in storage for about ten years. The former captain discovered the loss upon moving to Adelaide recently, though he stopped short of suggesting it had been stolen.

MS Dhoni arrives in India from US vacation amid wait for IPL retention rulesMS Dhoni landed in India amid the building anticipation over his retention in CSK franchise for IPL 2025. The BCCI and IPL governing council are expected to announce the retention rules soon.

OTD in 2010: CSK became 1st team to win both titles of IPL and CLT20 in a yearOn This Day in 2010, CSK scripted history by becoming the first-ever team to win both IPL and CPL in a single year. They beat Mumbai Indians in IPL 2010 final and Warriors in the summit clash of Champions League T20.

Jitesh could pip Kishan for 2nd wicketkeeper's slot in T20IsIndia vs Bangladesh: Jitesh Sharma could be selected over Ishan Kishan as the second wicketkeeper for the Indian team led by Suryakumar Yadav in the T20I upcoming series. The announcement of the Indian squad is expected later this week.

Watch: Indian team starts training in Kanpur amid fun chats and bantersThe Indian team began intense training at the Green Park Stadium in Kanpur amid fun chats and banter among players. The 2nd Test match between India and Bangladesh will begin on September 27.

Kanpur curator hints pitch to favour both pace and spin in 2nd TestIndia vs Bangladesh: Green Park curator Shiv Kumar revealed that the pitch for the second Test will offer a balanced contest for both pacers and spinners. The pitch is expected to provide bounce and movement for fast bowlers in the early stages and favour spinners from Day 3 onwards.

Didn't have inspiration to play IPL and domestic cricket: Shikhar DhawanFormer India opener Shikhar Dhawan revealed that he didn't have the "inspiration" left to take the domestic cricket route for a place in the national side.

Inspired by Bishan Singh Bedi: Yuvraj Singh opens up on his coaching mantraIndia great Yuvraj Singh revealed how his coaching philosophy draws inspiration from his late mentor Bishan Singh Bedi. Yuvraj continues to impart Bedi's principles while mentoring young talents like Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma in the evolving world of cricket.

Eriksen's strike cancelled as Manchester United draw vs TwenteEuropa League: Manchester United kicked off their 2024/25 campaign with a 1-1 draw against FC Twente at Old Trafford. Christian Eriksen's stunning goal was cancelled out by Sam Lammers' equaliser, leaving United with just a point.

Bangladesh start rigorous training before all-important Kanpur TestIND vs BAN: Najmul Hossain Shanto's men have started training hard in a bid to make a comeback in the second Test against India, starting September 27 at the Green Park in Kanpur.

India women welcomed by Rana Daggubati on Dubai arrival T20 World Cup: Actor Rana Daggubati greeted the Harmanpreet Kaur-led Indian women's team on their arrival in Dubai. India are scheduled to begin their campaign on October 4 against New Zealand.

He praised their thought process, hailing it as being on a different level than anyone else.

He praised their thought process, hailing it as being on a different level than anyone else.

Akash Deep not feeling Australia selection pressure : I live in the presentIndia pacer Akash Deep remains focused on the present, not letting pressure affect him ahead of a potential Border Gavaskar Trophy selection. He continues to prioritize the Bangladesh series, following his impressive performances since debuting earlier this year.

He makes things simple: Akash Deep hails 'supportive' Rohit SharmaIND vs BAN: Speedster Akash Deep said that captain Rohit Sharma gives enough support to the Indian cricketers and makes life simpler for them.

Vinesh Phogat served whereabouts failure notice by anti doping agencyParis Olympics 2024: Vinesh Phogat has been served a whereabouts failure notice by National Anti-Doping Agency (NADA) for reportedly not being available for a dope test on September 9 at her house in Sonepat.

Navdeep Singh, Avani, Sumit on inspiring journey to Paralympics gloryIndia's Paralympic medallists—Avani Lekhara, Navdeep Singh, and Sumit Antil—shared their inspirational journeys to glory during India Today's Mumbai Conclave 2024. They opened up about overcoming the challenges posed by their disabilities to achieve remarkable success on the world stage.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
